Detailed Description

Components Component Manager API.

This file contains the Component Manager API for manipulating components.

Note:
The purpose of this dedicated API is mainly for dealing with host C++ core programming model which is not the same as the component base one used on sub-system core.

Function Documentation

IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_BindComponentFromUser ( const t_cm_instance_handle  server,
const char *  providedItfServerName,
t_uint32  fifosize,
NMF::InterfaceReference *  itfref 
)

Bind the Host to a component in C++.

Create a binding between the Host and a server component running on a MPC in C++.

This method and the returned interface can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle server;
 Iservice T;
 t_cm_error error;

 error = CM_BindComponentFromUser(
     server,
     "input",
     8,
     &T);

 T.meth(123);

In this example, we assume that the Iservice type was generated by tools using the "service.itf" interface file description that can look like this:

 void meth(t_uint24 i);

In fact, this method do exactly the same thing as the definition bellow in the architecture file in the static Nomadik Kernel approach:

 binds arm.T to serverName.input
Parameters:
[in] server The server component instance handle.
[in] providedItfServerName The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] fifosize the number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request)
[out] itfref The itfref to be filled and called during a Host to MPC communication.
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE Interface name not provided by the component.
CM_BINDING_COMPONENT_NOT_FOUND Binding component require for this binding not found in the component repository.
CM_INVALID_PARAMETER Invalid parameter (Fifo too bug, ...)
CM_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_BindComponentToUser ( const t_nmf_channel  channel,
const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
void *  clientContext,
t_uint32  fifosize 
)

Bind a component to the user process.

Create a asynchronous binding between client component running on a MPC and the user programm by using the specified channel (the one where all messages concerning this binding will arrive)

This method can be used like this in C: 

 void mymeth(void *THIS, t_uint24 i) {
   // Automatically called by the client MPC component.
 }

 Iservice myT = {0, {mymeth}};

 void main() {
   t_cm_instance_handle client;
   t_nmf_channel channel;
   t_cm_error error;

   ...
   error = CM_BindComponentToUser(
       channel,
       client,
       "output",
       &myT,
       8);
 }

This method can be used like this in C++: 

 class mycb: public serviceDescriptor {
    void meth(t_uint24) {
      // Automatically called by the client MPC component.
    }
 };

 mycb mycbi;

 void main() {
   t_cm_instance_handle client;
   t_cm_error error;

   error = CM_BindComponentToUser(
       channel,
       client,
       "output",
       &mycbi,
       8);
 }

See CM_BindComponentFromUser for detail about Iservice.

In fact, this method do exactly the same thing as the definition bellow in the architecture file in the static Nomadik Kernel approach:

 binds clientName.output to arm.myT
Warning:
Be careful, since no copy is done of the content of the clientContext.
Parameters:
[in] channel The channel on which the binding must be done
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] clientContext The user context to be returned when getting incoming message.
[in] fifosize the number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request)
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_BINDING_COMPONENT_NOT_FOUND Binding component require for this binding not found in the component repository.
CM_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED Required interface must be unbinded before rebind.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
CM_INVALID_PARAMETER Invalid parameter (Fifo too bug, ...)
CM_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_UnbindComponentFromUser ( NMF::InterfaceReference *  itfref  ) 

unBind a component from the Host in C++.

Destroy a binding between the Host and a server component running on a MPC in C++.

Parameters:
[in] itfref Interface handle to be unbound.
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_PARAMETER Invalid parameter (NULL reference)
CM_ILLEGAL_UNBINDING Try to unbind component bind with other binding factories.
IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_UnbindComponentToUser ( const t_nmf_channel  channel,
const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
void **  clientContext 
)

Unbind a component to the User.

Parameters:
[in] channel The channel on which the binding has been done
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[out] clientContext return user context, pointer can be NULL.
Warning:
It is up to the caller to garantee that the given channel is the one used for this binding (ie is the same as the one given to the CM_BindComponentToUser() call)
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED The required interface is not binded.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
CM_ILLEGAL_UNBINDING Try to unbind component bind with other binding factories.
